Took me a while to figure it out, but it is now playable.

1) Get rid of the Tunngle folder - you don't need it :))

2) To avoid getting yelled at when connecting to a server due to an invalid serial key, you need to add the key to your registry. To do that, go to the ArmA 2 Free folder and run "ARMA2AO_Install any Update_WIN.32bit.reg". To be on the safe side, right-click on the .reg file and select "edit". Replace [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREBohemia Interactive StudioArmA 2 OA] with [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeBohemia Interactive StudioArmA 2 OA] save the file and then run it again.

3) The only thing left to do now is tell the DayZCommander where to look for ArmA. Run the commander located in "DayZ CommanderCurrent". Click "Settings" on the top of the window. Under "Game Directories" tick override for each directory. Now, I have extracted the contents of the downloaded archive to D: so you need to change the following according to where you've put it.
Arma2 Directory: D:Bohemia InteractiveArmA 2 Free
Arma2 OA Directory D:Bohemia InteractiveArmA 2 Free
DayZ Directory: D:Bohemia Interactive@Dayz

4) Remember to connect to servers labeled "NO CD" and you should be good to go!

All back slashes have been removed from my previous post for some reason...
Here are the values where you need to replace / with the back slash character:

[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/Bohemia Interactive Studio/ArmA 2 OA]
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/Wow6432Node/Bohemia Interactive Studio/ArmA 2 OA]
D:/Bohemia Interactive/ArmA 2 Free
D:/Bohemia Interactive/@Dayz
